poem:
Title: Amidst the Ashes

Here dances Beirut, shoeless on cinder dreams,
On this stage, charred by disaster's seam.
Amidst the ruins, a silent song takes wing.
Every splintered day, a celluloid rebirth brings.
Costa Brava rising, from the dust of loss,
In defiance of chaos, a relentless boss.
An office erased, but stories breathe anew,
The director calls 'action', in the viewfinder's hue.

But Beirut is in chaos. It’s 2020, just weeks after the catastrophic port explosion that killed more than 200 people and injured thousands. The blast destroyed the office of the production company,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
